info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 2:54PM CDT until June 16 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron and Willacy.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, La Feria, Santa Rosa, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley, Primera, Combes, Dishman Elementary School, Combes Community Center, Wilson Elementary School, Yznaga, Tierra Bonita, Doctor Hesiquio Rodriguez Elementary School, Palm Valley Police Department, Santa Rosa High School, Santa Rosa Police Department, Grand Acres, Harlingen High School, Marine Military Academy and Texas State Technical College Harlingen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
